definition: in the dark/in secret/on the sly/surreptitiously
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: They climb walls, leap off buildings and spy on enemies.
sentences.chinese: 它們會爬牆，能跳下大樓，還能暗中監視敵人。

sentences.english: Be vigilant against the danger of enemy agents infiltrating the government and boring from within.
sentences.chinese: 警惕敵特滲入政府內部進行暗中破壞。

sentences.english: Any of us can be attacked by the dark at anytime.
sentences.chinese: 任何我們的人都可能在任何時間被暗中進犯。

sentences.english: It never came to me that Frank would stab me in the back.
sentences.chinese: 我從來沒有想過富蘭克會給我在暗中使壞。

sentences.english: Allthe cats are grey in the dark.
At midday you will grope about like a blind man in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 你必在午間摸索，好像瞎子在暗中摸索一樣。

sentences.english: Tonight after, he almost can affirm is Yang Mu You is secretly manipulating everything.
sentences.chinese: 今夜之後，他幾乎可以肯定是楊幕友在暗中操縱一切。

sentences.english: John had a sneaking suspicion that his wife was lying about how the car had gotten scratched.
sentences.chinese: 約翰暗中懷疑他妻子對於汽車是怎麼擦破的說了謊。

sentences.english: Quiet backside, ma Jiming is investigated secretly in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 平靜背後，馬其鳴暗中祕密調查。

sentences.english: Who wants to be spied on by them?
sentences.chinese: 誰希望讓他們暗中監視呢？

sentences.english: This man always plays tricks in secret.
The prime minister YuWenHuaJi in order to take the throne with collude with the turks.
sentences.chinese: 丞相宇文化及爲了奪取皇位同突厥暗中勾結。

sentences.english: He watched them secretly, through a chink in the wall.
sentences.chinese: 他透過牆縫暗中監視他們。

sentences.english: Without light, they grope in the dark and stagger like drunkards.
sentences.chinese: 在無光的黑暗中摸索，踉蹌猶如醉漢。

sentences.english: Cheng bite gold smell speech secretly urged QinQiong show identity.
sentences.chinese: 程咬金聞言暗中催促秦瓊表露身份。

sentences.english: He felt his way to the door in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 他在黑暗中摸索着走到門囗。

definition: to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to kill secretly/to stab in the back
see 居心叵測|居心叵测[ju1 xin1 po3 ce4]
to collude with/to collaborate with/to gang up with
to harbor evil intentions (idiom); concealing malice
to reckon/to calculate/to plan/to expect/to scheme
